data.title: Wheeler Dealers... WTF
data.text:
Just found this related show, Deals on wheels from 1997.

What was that show with a bloke (Tony? Tommy?) building a kit car?

Someone put boot polish on the inside of his safety goggles and when he took them off he spent the rest of the programme looking like a startled Panda.... Class!

As I've been known to watch a bit too much telly, have quite a good memory, don't mind doing a bit of research and can occasionally be arsed to write something comprehensive I thought I would create this handy, accurate*, pocket-sized*, comprehensive* guide to motoring tv shows because being a car enthusiast means you'll often watch some right old tat because it has motors in it.

With the exception of the first you should most of these on TV (sometimes on obscure channels at odd times) or on the internet or for sale on dvd/blu-ray.

Wheelbase

When: 1964-1973

Episodes:207

Made by: The BBC.

Presenters: Cliff Michelmore, Gordon Wilkins, LJK Setright

I have never seen this but it would appear to have been an informative motoring show which proceeded Old Top Gear. I imagine that the backgrounds of location shoots will be mecca for tat spotters, nevermind the features such as an interview with William Lyons and a Gilbern special.

http://ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/series/1401

If that wasn't enough, check out this title shot.

If anyone finds this show (YaTube, online, download, vhs, dvd etc) I really need to see it.

Good Points:?

Bad Points:?

Worth watching for:?

Old "Top Gear"

When: 1977-2001

Episodes:515

Made by: The BBC.

Presenters: William (one foot on bumper, one hand on raised knee) Woollard, Noel Edmonds, Tony Mason, Angela Rippon, VBH, Quentin Wilson, Chris Goffey, Clarkson, James May, Steve Berry, Brendan Coogan, Jon Bentley, Adrian Simpson, Tiffany Dell and probably quite a few others over 24 years.

Informative motoring show, anchored by Woolard (later a different one of the presenters each week) featuring lots of informative features and lingering shots of switchgear and bootspaces. Great for figuring out whether to buy the Montego 1.6 GL or Cavalier 1.6 GLS.

Later increased viewing figures by becoming more sensationalist and heading away information for the average motorist.

Spawned Top Gear Rally Report (remember when rallying was popular?) and yearly British motorshow coverage.

Good Points:Pick a car from '77-'01 and find contemporary road tests on YaTube.

Bad Points: Noel Edmonds pans Fiat Strada, early episodes can be dull.

Worth watching for: Huge sea change in motoring attitudes over 24 year period.

New "Top Gear"

When: 2002 - present

Episodes: shitloads, they're all on Dave.

Made by: The BBC.

Presenters: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond, James May (replaced Jason Dawe)

Popular entertainment show dressed up as a car show, features celebrity guests, powerslides in expensive cars, foolish challenges, destruction of old BL tat, dismissive attitude to used cars and classics and grammatically poor use of the word "horsepower" and "torque".

Good Points:Makes motoring fun for the masses, Jeremy Clarkson, exotic cars, specials (south america, north pole, vietnam), beautifully shot.

Bad Points: Jeremy Clarkson, poor attitude to old cars, India special.

Worth watching for: Different things to different people.

Top Gear America

When: 2010 - present

Episodes: 26

Made by: BBC Worldwide

Presenters: Redneck in a check-shirt, slick racing driver and (sometimes) angry New England type.

US version of British New Top Gear, slightly less populist, slightly more car focused but American-biased.

Like/dislike of the presenters can greatly affect enjoyment of this show.

Good Points: American motoring perspective, beautifully shot.

Bad Points: American motoring perspective and attitude toward non-US cars, whooping and hollering of audience.

Worth watching for: Challenges, better execution that UK TG.

Top Gear Australia

When: 2008 - 2011

Episodes: 24

Made by: BBC Worldwide

Presenters: Blokes. OZZIE BLOKES. THREE OF THEM!

OZ version of British New Top Gear, slightly less populist, slightly more car focused but American-biased.

Like/dislike of the presenters can greatly affect enjoyment of this show.

Good Points: OZ motoring perspective, beautifully shot, OZ historical pieces.

Bad Points: Star in a Bog Standard car. Never heard of any of them.

Worth watching for: Love of V8s.

Top Gear Russia

When: 2009

Episodes: 17 or so

Made by: BBC Worldwide

Presenters: Three russian blokes, one of which is a carbon copy of Hammond

Carbon Copy of UK show. In russian

Good Points: You don't need subtitles, just turn the sound down and imagine what Clarkson-ski, May-ski and Hammond-ski are saying. If you've seen more than three episodes of UK TG you'll be fine.

Bad Points: Lack of Ladas, UAZ, GAZ, URAL, Volga et al.

Worth watching for: UAZ feature (there was one, once)

Top Gear China & Top Gear Korea

When: In the past few years.

Episodes: some

Made by: BBC Worldwide

I have never seen these shows.

Driven

When: 1998-2002

Episodes: 80

Made by: Independent for Channel 4

Presenters: Penny mallory, Jason potato, annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer, Jason Barlow, James May

Motor show originally competing with Old Top Gear. Featured presenter interaction and central location (sound familiar?) when TG didn't. Attempt at motoring info with group tests, 2nd hand buys etc, let down by element of silly challenges.

Good Points: Cars of the period.

Bad Points: Dull Penny Mallory & annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer.

Worth watching for: ....

5th Gear / Fifth Gear

When: 2002 - present

Episodes: 195

Made by: Independent for Channel 5, later Discovery UK

Presenters: Jason potato, Tom Ford, Tiffany Dell, VBH, Jonny Smith, Qunetin Wilson, Jon Bentley and some others.

Replacement for old Top Gear, swiftly crushed in the ratings by New Top Gear. Far more of car show but struggling with the balance of silly challenges in the name of entertainment and viewing figures (eg racehorse v Range Rover on road tyres)

Good Points: Openness to alternative technologies. VBH, if you like that sort of thing.

Bad Points: Ratings chasing acts such as bringing in non-car presenter Tim Lovejoy to get football fans to watch the show and stupid celebrity challenges.

Worth watching for: Facts and figure based sports car track tests.

Deals on Wheels

When: 1997-2001

Episodes: quite a few.

Made by: Independent for Channel 4

Presenters: Richard Sutton and annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Classic car journalist Sutton and annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer present real people selling real old cars, the background to sale is shown and then the two presenters discuss the points to watch on the car with a price prediction followed by footage of the sale conclusion. Also buying advice for one other model and sale/car/money challenges for one or both presenters.

Good Points: Oddball cars

Bad Points: annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer.

Worth watching for: At least one autoshiter appeared.

Wheeler Dealers

When: 2003 - present

Episodes: quite a few.

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Ed China and annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer buys a car, Ed fixes/mods/upgrades car and then Annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer sells car on for a "profit", info on car and parts suppliers / specialists included.

Good Points: Oddball cars

Bad Points: annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer, Cost of Ed's time.

Worth watching for: Prices/deals done. Annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer.

Auto Trader

When: Recently

Episodes: not too many.

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Ed China and annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer guides a buyer through their purchasing query (mid-life crises sports car, work truck etc) with test drives, prices and common faults, Ed fixes up a car that a punter is struggling to sell and Annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer does a how to spot a dodgy .... feature.

Good Points: Ed's fixing up

Bad Points: annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Worth watching for: Punter's trying to sell some total shit heaps.

Revved Up

When: Early Noughties

Episodes: not too many.

Made by: Independent for UK satellite channel

Presenters: annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer talks nonsense with barry-boys Max Power types, air filter big bore exhaust, shit bodykits for hatchback etc. The series progressed mods to Mike's car, a k-series engined bubble Rover.

Good Points: ...

Bad Points: annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Worth watching for: annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer

Pulling Power

Pulling Power was a regional motoring programme shown only in the Central Television region on ITV in 1996. However, it returned in 2005 and was shown on the ITV1 on a series trial basis until 2008, and it was also as a filler programme at times. It has also been shown on ITV4. Presenters included annoying cockney twat Mike Brewer, Michele Newman and Mike Rutherford, Sarah-Jane Mee and Edd China.

I don't remember this show and can only find one clip on YaTube.

It appears to be total crap.

Wrecks to Riches

When: Recently

Episodes: not too many.

Made by: Independent for UK satellite channel

Presenters: Dominic Littlewood, VBH (later some other bird), Connor the workshop manager and one or two workshop monkeys.

Littlwood meets the punter with a purchasing quandry (desire or need for first car / big 4x4 /sports car/ mpv) and not enough cash. Littlewood then sources a write-off to fix and modify for the punter. The workshop monkeys moan about the work Dom's given them and Connor moans about the money. VBH drives a non-write off example in a road test and points out how expensive it is. The punter then sees the motor at the end and can either buy (price is cost of write off, cost of goods and labour but no profit) or walk away.

Good Points: Actual repair work.

Bad Points: Dominic Littlewood

Worth watching for: The episodes where the punter sees the car and says "no way".

Vroom Vroom

When: 2005ish

Episodes: let's guess at 16.

Made by: Sky 1

Presenters: Brendan Coogan and some other people you haven't heard of.

Think low rent, poor man's 5th gear.

Good Points: ...

Bad Points: Everything

Worth watching for: Its not.

Classic Car Club

When: 2005ish

Episodes: not many, one series made.

Made by: Independent for UK satellite channel

Presenters: Penny Mallory, Alex Riley, Ed China, Tony Mason

Show about classic cars. Presenter introduces car, meets rivet-counting owner, takes car out and potters down country lane, says nice things about car.

Quite a dull show presented by dull people. The driving segment never seemed to exceed 40mph, whether in a 1930s Rolls Royce, an AC Cobra or a rally-prepared Big Healey.

For a former rally driver (named after a racing circuit) Penny Mallory drives bloody slowly.

Good Points: It might feature a car you like.

Bad Points: Its dull. Very dull. You might watch an episode with no cars that interest you.

Worth watching for: If there was nothing else on and your internet was broken it might just be worth watching.

Classic Gear

When: 2009-2010

Episodes: not many, .

Made by: Independent for UK satellite channel

Presenters: Penny Mallory, chris serle, jason dawe, tony mason

Show about classic cars. Presenter introduces car, meets rivet-counting owner, takes car out and potters down country lane, says nice things about car.

Quite a dull show presented by dull people. The driving segment never seemed to exceed 40mph, whether in a 1930s Rolls Royce, an AC Cobra or a rally-prepared Big Healey.

For a former rally driver (named after a racing circuit) Penny Mallory drives bloody slowly.

Slightly different people but similar to Classic Car Club

Good Points: The ever jolly Tony Mason

Bad Points: Its dull.

Worth watching for: If there was nothing else on and your internet was broken it might just be worth watching.

Off The Road

When: Noughties

Episodes: not many, one series .

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Perma-flat capped, every jolly, rotund dwarf Tony Mason.

Tony Mason gets off-road instruction, visits 4x4 and truck events and follows international rallys. Off-road use, rather than shiny new SUV, biased.

Good Points: variety of off-road machinery

Bad Points: Tony Mason, sometimes out of his depth. Doesn't feature D701SWL.

Worth watching for: Tony Mason falling over.

A ... Is Born/Reborn

When: 1999- late noughties

Episodes: quite a lot .

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Cheerful vet and tinkerer Mark Evans, producer/director Pete-mate and almost-silent technical chap Les.

Mark Evans builds or restores a variety of vehicles (E-type, cobra kit, westfield, bikes, hybrid LR, kit plane and kit helicopter).

Each vehicle is built/restored over ten half-hour episodes which episode also featuring a comparable vehicle and Mark receiving training on the operation of his vehicle.

Good Points: Actual technical work presented with homour

Bad Points: One or two shortcuts / things not shown..

Worth watching for: Finished product.

Wreck Rescue

When: 2009

Episodes: 6 .

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Cheerful vet and tinkerer Mark Evans.

Mark Evans chronicles a restoration project. Assists motivates the restorer and does background on the vehicle.

Good Points: Good balance of tech, human interest and info.

Bad Points: Each one could be made a bit longer than one hour.

Worth watching for: Progression of restorer from rank amateur to competent(ish) mechanic

Dream Machines

When: early noughties

Episodes: one series .

Made by: Channel 5

Presenters: Cheerful vet and tinkerer Mark Evans

Mark Evans leads a restoration time (one hour show per car) in a well lit studio with some background info and the chance to win the car.

I barely remember this one, think it might have tried to cram too much into one hour, I think it was on at teatime.

Good Points:

Bad Points:

Worth watching for:

Bangla Bangers

When: noughties

Episodes: one series .

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Angry fat bald swearing cockney mechanic Bernie and mad Bangladeshi coachbuilder Leepu.

Bernie goes to Bangladesh to work with Leepu building sports cars and limos from scrap.

Bernie gets angry and shouts about time taken, lack of parts, cost of parts etc, Leepu talks bollocks, never draws his designs and uses too much filler.

End product looks like shit.

Good Points: The ad break in the middle.

Bad Points: the bit between the credits.

Worth watching for: Bernie struggling with the heat and the language barrier.

Chop Shop: London Garage

When: noughties

Episodes: too many.

Made by: Independent for Discovery UK

Presenters: Angry fat bald swearing cockney mechanic Bernie and mad Bangladeshi coachbuilder Leepu.

Leepu comes to London to work with Bernie building sports cars and limos from scrap.

Bernie gets angry and shouts about time taken, lack of parts, cost of parts etc, Leepu talks bollocks, never draws his designs and uses too much filler.

End product looks like shit.

Good Points: The ad break in the middle

Bad Points: the bit between the credits.

Worth watching for: The workshop fire which destroyed their car.

Classic Car Rescue

When: 2012

Episodes: hopefully not too many .

Made by: Channel 5

Presenters: Angry fat bald swearing cockney mechanic Bernie and some Canadian bloke.

Bernie and Canadian make bad purchasing decision, fake resto and play up crises for camera. Bernie gets angry and shouts about time taken, lack of parts, cost of parts etc,

Car over valued at the end.

Good Points: The ad break in the middle.

Bad Points: the bit between the credits.

Worth watching for: ...

I'll go through the American stuff as well if anyone is interested.
